image.altText: Jeremy Rockliff gestures while speaking in parliament.

items.synopsis: Jeremy Rockliff announces he is stepping down as health minister, while reminding two rogue MPs they were elected as Liberals, not independents.

title.children: 'They were elected on our team': Tasmanian premier issues stern reminder to rogue MPs

image.altText: Composite image of Hannah Wilkinson and Sam Kerr.

items.synopsis: Matildas captain Sam Kerr won't play in Australia's first World Cup match on home soil due to a calf injury, as New Zealand claims the first match of the tournament against Norway. Follow live.

title.children: Sam Kerr out due to injury as New Zealand claims famous World Cup match against Norway

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: ABC Sport journalist Samantha Lewis is at Sydney stadium ahead of the Matildas first World Cup match on home soil. The significance of Sam Kerr 's absence from this opening game against Republic of Ireland can't be overstated. She isn't just the team's all-time leading goal-scorer, whose experience playing in big games like FA Cup finals has taught her how to show up in big moments like World Cup openers, but she's also a significant leader on the field. The work she does when nobody is watching — the runs she makes, the space she creates, the channels she opens for others, her threat in the air — is a big part of why the Matildas have become who they are. She is the one player who is practically irreplaceable. What does head coach Tony Gustavsson do from here? Youngster Mary Fowler seems to have been picked as Kerr's understudy at centre-forward, but whether she has the gravity to her that Kerr does — and is able to push and pull defenders quite as well as her captain — is a real doubt. This puts a lot more pressure on the team's other forwards like Hayley Raso, Cortnee Vine, and Caitlin Foord to step up and take their opportunities as soon as they arrive, because their opposition won't be giving them many at all.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Analysis: Sam Kerr's absence can't be overstated

props.alt: Sam Kerr sits on the sidelines with her head down.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: It is one of the great moments in New Zealand sport. They have never won a match at the FIFA World Cup Finals. Norway are one of the favourites in this tournament. They have won, 1-0. AMAZING
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: FULL TIME: NEW ZEALAND PULL OFF A FAMOUS WIN

children.content: It is one of the great moments in New Zealand sport.
They have never won a match at the FIFA World Cup Finals.
Norway are one of the favourites in this tournament.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Matildas captain Sam Kerr won't be hitting the field tonight for the Matildas first Women's World Cup match on home soil. The Matildas have confirmed the Kerr picked up a calf injury during training. "Sam will be unavailable for the next two matches with the Matildas Medical Team to re-assess her following our second group stage match," the team wrote on social media one hour before kick off.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Sam Kerr out of action due to calf injury, Matildas announce

children.content: Matildas captain Sam Kerr won't be hitting the field tonight for the Matildas first Women's World Cup match on home soil.
The Matildas have confirmed the Kerr picked up a calf injury during training.
"Sam will be unavailable for the next two matches with the Matildas Medical Team to re-assess her following our second group stage match," the team wrote on social media one hour before kick off.

image.altText: Man in a black shirt and grey hoodie standing outside.

items.synopsis: Aiden Aslin survived five months of torture in Russian captivity. Now free, he wants to share the story of one Ukrainian man who didn't make it out alive. WARNING: Some readers may find the details of this story distressing.

title.children: Aiden thought his Russian captors could stoop no lower as they tortured him. Then they got a camera out

image.altText: Mitch Starc plays a shot

items.synopsis: Australia resumes on day two just shy of 300 with two first innings wickets remaining, but the bowlers will already be thinking of lining up England's openers in the fourth Ashes Test from Old Trafford. Follow live.

title.children: Australia resumes first innings, but with one eye on bowling on day two at Old Trafford

image.altText: An illuminated Deloitte logo in a foyer with an arrangement of flowers beneath.

items.synopsis: A senator examining the big four consulting firms says Deloitte should be recalled over reports one of its ex-partners, David Milo, shared private military documents obtained while at the firm in order to win work for his own fledgling company.

title.children: Senator calls for Deloitte to face fresh grilling over claims ex-partner David Milo shared military documents

image.altText: Emily and Nick Judd sit together in a park, and Emily holds a green book

items.synopsis: Emily and Nick's son Jack was born still at 39 weeks. They wanted to buy a keepsake to remember him, and were surprised by how difficult it was to find something.

image.altText: A fire truck driving and two people in high vis clothing walk along a busy highway.

image.altText: A well dressed woman arrives at court

image.altText: A black-and-white close-up of a gaunt and harrowed-looking man with a stetson hat and a cigarette in his mouth.

image.altText: A woman wearing a red scarf looks at the camera.

title.children: 'I didn't have a voice': Ex-servicewoman tells commission of feeling isolated after sexual assault

title.children: Gold Coast mayor says city prepared to host '26 Commonwealth Games, with provisos

title.children: Russian bombing of grain port in Ukraine prompts global wheat price hike

image.altText: A casket in a cathedral

title.children: Anthony Albanese labels Simon Crean 'man of decency' as mourners bid farewell to the former Labor leader

image.altText: A glass pipe, used for smoking the drug ice, sits on a bench.

title.children: Court hears of horrific final moments of man’s life before 'brutal' murder by laughing, meth-crazed killer

title.children: 'Vote No' to Voice to Parliament flyers peddling false claims under investigation by election watchdog

image.altText: A dirt-coloured cylinder is seen at the bottom of a dirt pit. Earthworks have been conducted around it, establishing walls.

image.altText: A large crocodile resting in the sun on a muddy bank

image.altText: A man and woman stand in front of plants, they are looking directly towards the camera
